subject: Re: [junit] does cactus support ejb2.0  and weblogic6.0
msgSnippet: Answer is yes but could you post any Cactus related message on the cactus-user mailing list please ? (see http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/mailinglist.html).
messageBody:
Answer is yes but could you post any Cactus related message on the cactus-user mailing list please ? (see http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/mailinglist.html).
Thanks
-Vincent
 
----- Original Message -----
From: gopala krishnan T
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, September 25, 2001 11:23 AM
Subject: [junit] does cactus support ejb2.0 and weblogic6.0

we are using EJB 2.0 on Weblogic(6.0).Does cactus works on th above details.as u ahev given that it is tested on weblogicv(5.1)
----- Original Message -----
From: vmassol@...
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, September 25, 2001 4:16 PM
Subject: [junit] [announce] Cactus v1.2 is released

The Jakarta Cactus project (http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus) is
proud to announce the release of version 1.2. Cactus is a unit
testing framework for testing server side java code. It supports unit
testing of :

* Servlets,
* JSP Tag libraries,
* Servlet Filters,
* EJBs,
* JSPs

Please check the Features list
(http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/features.html) and the Changelog
(http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/changes.html#release_changes) for
details on what's new.

Cactus also provides several Jakarta Ant scripts to automate unit
testing on your server and has been tested on the following servers :
Tomcat (v3.2, v3.3, v4.0), Resin (v1.2, v1.3, v2.0), Orion (1.4, 1.5)
and WebLogic (v5.1). It works with all Servlet 2.2 and 2.3 compliant
servlet engines.

In addition, Cactus 1 adds tight integration with HttpUnit for easy
asserting of server responses.

Thank you
-The Cactus Team
